member.name: T:Matrix.IO.Compression.Checksums.Adler32
member.summary:
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: T:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater
member.summary:
This is the Deflater class. The deflater class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.
This class is not thread safe. This is inherent in the API, due to the split of deflate and setInput.
author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.BEST_SPEED
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.DEFLATED
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with default compression level.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION, or DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION.
true, if we should suppress the Zlib/RFC1950 header at the beginning and the adler checksum at the end of the output. This is useful for the GZIP/PKZIP formats.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: P:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Adler
member.summary: Gets the current adler checksum of the data that was processed so far.

member.name: P:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.TotalIn
member.summary: Gets the number of input bytes processed so far.

member.name: P:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.TotalOut
member.summary: Gets the number of output bytes so far.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. This is not part of Sun's JDK so I have made it package private. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement flush().

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: P:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true if the stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. If you call setInput when needsInput() returns false, the previous input that is still pending will be thrown away. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again. This call is equivalent to setInput(input, 0, input.length).
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished() or ended().

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
the number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was Finish()ed or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.GetLevel
member.summary: Get current compression level
member.returns: Returns the current compression level

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetStrategy(Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflateStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the compression strategy. Strategy is one of DEFAULT_STRATEGY, HUFFMAN_ONLY and FILTERED. For the exact position where the strategy is changed, the same as for SetLevel() applies.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deflates the current input block with to the given array.
member.param: The buffer where compressed data is stored
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished returns true or length is zero.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either needsInput() or finished() returns true or length is zero.
member.exception: If offset or length don't match the array length.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. This call is equivalent to setDictionary(dict, 0, dict.Length).
member.exception: if SetInput () or Deflate () were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. The dictionary is a byte array containing strings that are likely to occur in the data which should be compressed. The dictionary is not stored in the compressed output, only a checksum. To decompress the output you need to supply the same dictionary again.
member.param: The index where dictionary information commences.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: If SetInput () or Deflate() were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflateStrategy.HuffmanOnly
member.summary: This strategy will not look for string repetitions at all. It only encodes with Huffman trees (which means, that more common characters get a smaller encoding.

member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflaterEngine.prev
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.DeflaterEngine.window
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: T:Matrix.IO.Compression.Inflater
member.summary:
Inflater is used to decompress data that has been compressed according to the "deflate" standard described in rfc1951.
By default Zlib (rfc1950) headers and footers are expected in the input. You can use constructor public Inflater(bool noHeader) passing true if there is no Zlib header information
The usage is as following. First you have to set some input with SetInput(), then Inflate() it. If inflate doesn't inflate any bytes there may be three reasons:
IsNeedingInput() returns true because the input buffer is empty. You have to provide more input with SetInput(). NOTE: IsNeedingInput() also returns true when, the stream is finished.
IsNeedingDictionary() returns true, you have to provide a preset dictionary with SetDictionary().
IsFinished returns true, the inflater has finished.
Once the first output byte is produced, a dictionary will not be needed at a later stage.
author of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Inflater.CPLENS
member.summary: Copy lengths for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Extra bits for literal codes 257..285

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Inflater.CPDIST
member.summary: Copy offsets for distance codes 0..29

member.name: F:Matrix.IO.Compression.Inflater.CPDEXT
member.summary: Extra bits for distance codes

member.name: T:Matrix.IO.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator
member.summary:
This class allows us to retrieve a specified number of bits from the input buffer, as well as copy big byte blocks.
It uses an int buffer to store up to 31 bits for direct manipulation. This guarantees that we can get at least 16 bits, but we only need at most 15, so this is all safe.
There are some optimizations in this class, for example, you must never peek more than 8 bits more than needed, and you must first peek bits before you may drop them. This is not a general purpose class but optimized for the behaviour of the Inflater.
authors of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default StreamManipulator with all buffers empty

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.PeekBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next sequence of bits but don't increase input pointer. bitCount must be less or equal 16 and if this call succeeds, you must drop at least n - 8 bits in the next call.
member.param: The number of bits to peek.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available. */

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.DropBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Drops the next n bits from the input. You should have called PeekBits with a bigger or equal n before, to make sure that enough bits are in the bit buffer.
member.param: The number of bits to drop.

member.name: M:Matrix.IO.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.GetBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next n bits and increases input pointer. This is equivalent to followed by , except for correct error handling.
member.param: The number of bits to retrieve.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available.

member.summary: Gets the number of bits available in the bit buffer. This must be only called when a previous PeekBits() returned -1.
member.returns: the number of bits available.

member.name: T:Matrix.Net.AsyncUserToken
member.summary: This class is designed for use as the object to be assigned to the SocketAsyncEventArgs.UserToken property.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSessionRequestEventArgs.Wait
member.summary: Specifies the longest time (in seconds) that the connection manager is allowed to wait before responding to any request during the session. This enables the client to limit the delay before it discovers any network failure, and to prevent its HTTP/TCP connection from expiring due to inactivity.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSessionRequestEventArgs.Secure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this Bosh session is secure or not. All sessions (except of prebind) are secure by default. When a session is secure key sequencing is used.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.Wait
member.summary: The longest time (in seconds) that the connection manager is allowed to wait before responding to any request during the session. This enables the client to prevent its TCP connection from expiring due to inactivity, as well as to limit the delay before it discovers any network failure.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.KeepAlive
member.summary: Keep Alive for Webrequests

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.Hold
member.summary: This attribute specifies the maximum number of requests the connection manager is allowed to keep waiting at any one time during the session. If the client is not able to use HTTP Pipelining then this SHOULD be set to "1".

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.MaxPause
member.summary: If the connection manager supports session pausing (see Inactivity) then it SHOULD advertise that to the client by including a 'maxpause' attribute in the session creation response element. The value of the attribute indicates the maximum length of a temporary session pause (in seconds) that a client MAY request. 0 is the default value and indicated that the connection manager supports no session pausing.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.SenderThreadInterval
member.summary: Interval in milliseconds of the sender thread. The sender thread checks in this interal if new WebRequests must be sent to the server an if data for sending is available. The default interval is 500ms.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshException.CanRecover
member.summary: When true then the Bosh session can be recovered and MatriX will try to. Otherwise this is an unrecoverable error which results in close of the session. If MatriX sais this error in unrecoverable butu you still think the session can be recovered then set CanRevover to true in the OnError handler and MatriX will continue to send requests. Some http proxies or Apache with mod_proxy can return HTTP errors which cab be ignored in some environents, but cause an immediate disconnect according to the Bosh specs.

member.summary: Initializes the internal variables of this object
member.param: An object that contains state information for this request.

member.name: M:Matrix.Net.Proxy.IAsyncProxyResult.Reset
member.summary: Initializes the internal variables of this object

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.Proxy.IAsyncProxyResult.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the server has completed processing the call. It is illegal for the server to use any client supplied resources outside of the agreed upon sharing semantics after it sets the IsCompleted property to "true". Thus, it is safe for the client to destroy the resources after IsCompleted property returns "true".
member.value: A boolean that indicates whether the server has completed processing the call.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.Proxy.IAsyncProxyResult.CompletedSynchronously
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the BeginXXXX call has been completed synchronously. If this is detected in the AsyncCallback delegate, it is probable that the thread that called BeginInvoke is the current thread.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.Proxy.IAsyncProxyResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Gets an object that was passed as the state parameter of the BeginXXXX method call.
member.value: The object that was passed as the state parameter of the BeginXXXX method call.

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.Proxy.IAsyncProxyResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: The AsyncWaitHandle property returns the WaitHandle that can use to perform a WaitHandle.WaitOne or WaitAny or WaitAll. The object which implements IAsyncResult need not derive from the System.WaitHandle classes directly. The WaitHandle wraps its underlying synchronization primitive and should be signaled after the call is completed. This enables the client to wait for the call to complete instead polling. The Runtime supplies a number of waitable objects that mirror Win32 synchronization primitives e.g. ManualResetEvent, AutoResetEvent and Mutex. WaitHandle supplies methods that support waiting for such synchronization objects to become signaled with "any" or "all" semantics i.e. WaitHandle.WaitOne, WaitAny and WaitAll. Such methods are context aware to avoid deadlocks. The AsyncWaitHandle can be allocated eagerly or on demand. It is the choice of the IAsyncResult implementer.
member.value: The WaitHandle associated with this asynchronous result.

members.member: Represents one or more characters of data.
Represents a newline (CR, LF or CR followed by LF) in data.
Represents a complete start-tag <name>, that doesn't have any attribute specifications.
Represents a complete start-tag <name att="val">, that contains one or more attribute specifications.
Represents an empty element tag <name/>, that doesn't have any attribute specifications.
Represents an empty element tag <name att="val"/>, that contains one or more attribute specifications.
Represents a complete end-tag </name>.
Represents the start of a CDATA section <![CDATA[.
Represents the end of a CDATA section ]]>.
Represents a general entity reference.
Represents a general entity reference to a one of the 5 predefined entities amp, lt, gt, quot, apos.
Represents a numeric character reference (decimal or hexadecimal), when the referenced character is less than or equal to 0xFFFF and so is represented by a single char.
Represents a numeric character reference (decimal or hexadecimal), when the referenced character is greater than 0xFFFF and so is represented by a pair of chars.
Represents a processing instruction.
Represents an XML declaration or text declaration (a processing instruction whose target is xml).
Represents a comment <!-- comment -->. This can occur both in the prolog and in content.
Represents a white space character in an attribute value, excluding white space characters that are part of line boundaries.
Represents a parameter entity reference in the prolog.
Represents whitespace in the prolog. The token contains one or more whitespace characters.
Represents <!NAME in the prolog.
Represents > in the prolog.
Represents a name in the prolog.
Represents a name token in the prolog that is not a name.
Represents #NAME in the prolog.
Represents | in the prolog.
Represents a % in the prolog that does not start a parameter entity reference. This can occur in an entity declaration.
Represents a ( in the prolog.
Represents a ) in the prolog that is not followed immediately by any of *, + or ?.
Represents [ in the prolog.
Represents ] in the prolog.
Represents a literal (EntityValue, AttValue, SystemLiteral or PubidLiteral).
Represents a name followed immediately by ?.
Represents a name followed immediately by *.
Represents a name followed immediately by +.
Represents <![ in the prolog.
Represents ]]> in the prolog.
Represents )? in the prolog.
Represents )* in the prolog.
Represents )+ in the prolog.
Represents , in the prolog.

members.member: Moves a position forward. On entry, pos gives the position of the byte at index off in buf. On exit, it pos will give the position of the byte at index end, which must be greater than or equal to off. The bytes between off and end must encode one or more complete characters. A carriage return followed by a line feed will be treated as a single line delimiter provided that they are given to movePosition together.

Returns an Encoding corresponding to the specified IANA character set name. Returns this Encoding if the name is null. Returns null if the specified encoding is not supported. Note that there are two distinct Encoding objects associated with the name UTF-16, one for each possible byte order; if this Encoding is UTF-16 with little-endian byte ordering, then getEncoding("UTF-16") will return this, otherwise it will return an Encoding for UTF-16 with big-endian byte ordering. @param name a string specifying the IANA name of the encoding; this is case insensitive

Returns an Encoding for entities encoded with a single-byte encoding (an encoding in which each byte represents exactly one character). @param map a string specifying the character represented by each byte; the string must have a length of 256; map.charAt(b) specifies the character encoded by byte b; bytes that do not represent any character should be mapped to \uFFFD

Returns an Encoding object for use with internal entities. This is a UTF-16 big endian encoding, except that newlines are assumed to have been normalized into line feed, so carriage return is treated like a space.

Checks that a literal contained in the specified byte subarray is a legal public identifier and returns a string with the normalized content of the public id. The subarray includes the opening and closing quotes. @exception InvalidTokenException if it is not a legal public identifier
Returns true if the specified byte subarray is equal to the string. The string must contain only XML significant characters.

Skips over XML whitespace characters at the start of the specified subarray.
@return the index of the first non-whitespace character, end if there is the subarray is all whitespace
Returns the minimum number of bytes required to represent a single character in this encoding. The value will be 1, 2 or 4.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Action.Alert
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?action=drop Behavior: The message is silently discarded but an alert is returned to the sender. Defined in XEP-0079: Advanced Message Processing.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Action.Drop
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?action=drop Behavior: The message is silently discarded. Defined in XEP-0079: Advanced Message Processing.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Action.Error
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?action=error Behavior: The message is not processed and an error is returned to the sender, specifying which rule resulted in failed processing. Defined in XEP-0079: Advanced Message Processing.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Action.Notify
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?action=notify Behavior: The message is processed and a notification message is returned to the sender, specifying which rule was processed. Defined in XEP-0079: Advanced Message Processing.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Amp.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the from Jid.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Amp.To
member.summary: Gets or sets the to Jid.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Amp.PerHop
member.summary: The 'per-hop' attribute flags the contained ruleset for processing at each server in the route between the original sender and original intended recipient. This attribute MAY be present, and MUST be either "true" or "false". If not present, the default is "false".

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Amp.Status
member.summary: The 'status' attribute specifies the reason for the amp element. When specifying semantics to be applied (client to server), this attribute MUST NOT be present. When replying to a sending entity regarding a met condition, this attribute MUST be present and SHOULD be the value of the 'action' attribute for the triggered rule. (Note: Individual action definitions MAY provide their own requirements.)

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Condition.Deliver
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?condition=deliver Syntax: [direct|forward|gateway|none|stored] Processing: The condition is met if (1) the value is "direct" and the message can be immediately delivered or further dispatched, or (2) the value is "stored" and offline storage is enabled. Per-Hop: true

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Condition.ExpireAt
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?condition=expire-at Syntax: DateTime per XEP-0082 Processing: The condition is met if the message cannot be delivered before the specified DateTime. Per-Hop: true

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Condition.MatchResource
member.summary: Namespace: http://jabber.org/protocol/amp?condition=match-resource Syntax: [any|exact|other] Processing: The condition is met if (1) the value is "any" and the intended recipient has at least one available resource (as defined in the XMPP IM specification); (2) the value "exact" and the intended recipient has an available resource that exactly matches the JID specified in the 'to' address; (3) the value is "other" and the intended recipient has an available resource whose full JID is other than that specified in the 'to' address. Per-Hop: false

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Rule.ValueAsString
member.summary: The 'value' attribute defines how the condition is matched. This attribute MUST be present, and MUST NOT be an empty string (""). The interpretation of this attribute's value is determined by the 'condition' attribute.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Rule.Action
member.summary: The 'action' attribute defines the result for this rule. This attribute MUST be present, and MUST be either a value defined in the Defined Actions section, or one registered with the XMPP Registrar.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.AdvancedMessageProcessing.Rule.Condition
member.summary: The 'condition' attribute defines the overall condition this rule applies to. This attribute MUST be present, and MUST be either a value defined in the Defined Conditions section, or one registered with the XMPP Registrar.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageArchiving.Session.Timeout
member.summary: The 'timeout' indicates how long this rule will stay in server after the latest message in this thread is exchanged. Server MUST NOT forget this rule before 'timeout' seconds after latest message in this thread is exchanged but MAY keep this rule longer than 'timeout' value specifies. Client MUST NOT set this , but wait for server's answer to know this value. If the client wants to keep this rule longer, it must send a new element to the server before this timeour expires.

member.summary: this method MUST NOT be used.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageArchiving.UseType.Prefer
member.summary: this method SHOULD be used if available.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Error.Condition
member.summary: the error condition

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Error.Text
member.summary: The optional error text

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition
member.summary: stanza error condition as defined in RFC 3920 9.3

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.BadRequest
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Conflict
member.summary: Access cannot be granted because an existing resource exists with the same name or address; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.FeatureNotImplemented
member.summary: The feature represented in the XML stanza is not implemented by the intended recipient or an intermediate server and therefore the stanza cannot be processed; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Forbidden
member.summary: The requesting entity does not possess the required permissions to perform the action; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Gone
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.InternalServerError
member.summary: The server could not process the stanza because of a misconfiguration or an otherwise-undefined internal server error; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait" or "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ItemNotFound
member.summary: The addressed JID or item requested cannot be found; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.JidMalformed
member.summary: The sending entity has provided or communicated an XMPP address (e.g., a value of the 'to' attribute) or aspect thereof (e.g., an XMPP resource identifier) that does not adhere to the syntax defined under RFC3920 Section 3 (Addresses); the associated error type SHOULD be "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAcceptable
member.summary: The recipient or server understands the request but is refusing to process it because it does not meet criteria defined by the recipient or server (e.g., a local policy regarding stanza size limits or acceptable words in messages); the associated error type SHOULD be "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAllowed
member.summary: The recipient or server does not allow any entity to perform the action (e.g., sending to entities at a blacklisted domain); the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAuthorized
member.summary: The sender must provide proper credentials before being allowed to perform the action, or has provided improper credentials; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotModified
member.summary: The item requested has not changed since it was last requested; the associated error type SHOULD be "continue".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.PaymentRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because payment is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RecipientUnavailable
member.summary: The intended recipient is temporarily unavailable; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".
member.remarks: An application MUST NOT return this error if doing so would provide information about the intended recipient's network availability to an entity that is not authorized to know such information; instead it SHOULD return a <service-unavailable/> error.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Redirect
member.summary: The recipient or server is redirecting requests for this information to another entity, typically in a temporary fashion; the associated error type SHOULD be "modify" and the error stanza SHOULD contain the alternate address (which SHOULD be a valid JID) in the XML character data of the <redirect/> element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RegistrationRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because prior registration is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerNotFound
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient does not exist; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerTimeout
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient (or required to fulfill a request) could not be contacted within a reasonable amount of time; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ResourceConstraint
member.summary: The server or recipient lacks the system resources necessary to service the request; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server or recipient does not currently provide the requested service; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".
member.remarks: An application SHOULD return a <service-unavailable/> error instead of <item-not-found/> or <recipient-unavailable/> if sending one of the latter errors would provide information about the intended recipient's network availability to an entity that is not authorized to know such information.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.SubscriptionRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because a prior subscription is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.UndefinedCondition
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.UnexpectedRequest
member.summary: The recipient or server understood the request but was not expecting it at this time (e.g., the request was out of order); the associated error type SHOULD be "wait" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.PolicyViolation
member.summary: the entity has violated some local service policy; the server MAY choose to specify the policy in the <text/> element or an application-specific condition element.

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence
member.summary: Presence Base class

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence.Status
member.summary: The OPTIONAL status contains a natural-language description of availability status. It is normally used in conjunction with the show element to provide a detailed description of an availability state (e.g., "In a meeting").

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence.Type
member.summary: The type of a presence stanza is OPTIONAL. A presence stanza that does not possess a type attribute is used to signal to the server that the sender is online and available for communication. If included, the type attribute specifies a lack of availability, a request to manage a subscription to another entity's presence, a request for another entity's current presence, or an error related to a previously-sent presence stanza.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence.Show
member.summary: The OPTIONAL show element contains non-human-readable XML character data that specifies the particular availability status of an entity or specific resource.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence.Priority
member.summary: The priority level of the resource. The value MUST be an integer between -128 and +127. If no priority is provided, a server SHOULD consider the priority to be zero.
member.remarks: For information regarding the semantics of priority values in stanza routing within instant messaging and presence applications, refer to Server Rules for Handling XML StanzasServer Rules for Handling XML Stanzas.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Body.Wait
member.summary: Specifies the longest time (in seconds) that the connection manager is allowed to wait before responding to any request during the session. This enables the client to limit the delay before it discovers any network failure, and to prevent its HTTP/TCP connection from expiring due to inactivity.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Body.MaxPause
member.summary: If the connection manager supports session pausing (inactivity) then it SHOULD advertise that to the client by including a 'maxpause' attribute in the session creation response element. The value of the attribute indicates the maximum length of a temporary session pause (in seconds) that a client MAY request.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Body.To
member.summary: Specifies the target domain of the first stream.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Body.Hold
member.summary: specifies the maximum number of requests the connection manager is allowed to keep waiting at any one time during the session. If the client is not able to use HTTP Pipelining then this SHOULD be set to "1".

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Body.Version
member.summary: Specifies the highest version of the BOSH protocol that the client supports. The numbering scheme is major.minor (where the minor number MAY be incremented higher than a single digit, so it MUST be treated as a separate integer).
member.remarks: The version should not be confused with the version of any protocol being transported.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.BadRequest
member.summary: The format of an HTTP header or binding element received from the client is unacceptable (e.g., syntax error).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.HostGone
member.summary: The target domain specified in the 'to' attribute or the target host or port specified in the 'route' attribute is no longer serviced by the connection manager.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.HostUnknown
member.summary: The target domain specified in the 'to' attribute or the target host or port specified in the 'route' attribute is unknown to the connection manager.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.ImproperAddressing
member.summary: The initialization element lacks a 'to' or 'route' attribute (or the attribute has no value) but the connection manager requires one.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.InternalServerError
member.summary: The connection manager has experienced an internal error that prevents it from servicing the request.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.ItemNotFound
member.summary: (1) 'sid' is not valid, (2) 'stream' is not valid, (3) 'rid' is larger than the upper limit of the expected window, (4) connection manager is unable to resend response, (5) 'key' sequence is invalid.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.OtherRequest
member.summary: Another request being processed at the same time as this request caused the session to terminate.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.PolicyViolation
member.summary: The client has broken the session rules (polling too frequently, requesting too frequently, sending too many simultaneous requests).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.RemoteConnectionFailed
member.summary: The connection manager was unable to connect to, or unable to connect securely to, or has lost its connection to, the server.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.RemoteStreamError
member.summary: Encapsulates an error in the protocol being transported.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.SeeOtherUri
member.summary: The connection manager does not operate at this URI (e.g., the connection manager accepts only SSL or TLS connections at some https: URI rather than the http: URI requested by the client). The client can try POSTing to the URI in the content of the <uri/> child element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.SystemShutdown
member.summary: The connection manager is being shut down. All active HTTP sessions are being terminated. No new sessions can be created.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Bosh.Condition.UndefinedCondition
member.summary: The error is not one of those defined herein; the connection manager SHOULD include application-specific information in the content of the wrapper.

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.GrantVoice(Matrix.Jid,System.String)
member.summary:
Granting voice to a visitor.
In a moderated room, a moderator may want to manage who does and does not have "voice" in the room (i.e., the ability to send messages to all occupants). Voice is granted based on the visitor's room nickname, which the service will convert into the visitor's full JID internally. The moderator grants voice to a visitor by changing the visitor's role to "participant".

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.GrantMembership(Matrix.Jid,Matrix.Jid)
member.summary:
Grant membership.
An admin can grant membership to a user; this is done by changing the user's affiliation to "member" (normally based on nick if the user is in the room, or on bare JID if not; in either case, if the nick is provided, that nick becomes the user's default nick in the room if that functionality is supported by the implementation).

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.GrantMembership(Matrix.Jid,System.String)

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.RevokeVoice(Matrix.Jid,System.String)
member.summary:
Revoke voice from a participant.
In a moderated room, a moderator may want to revoke a participant's privileges to speak. The moderator can revoke voice from a participant by changing the participant's role to "visitor".

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.PubSubManager.PurgeNode(Matrix.Jid,System.String)
member.summary:
Purges all node item.
If a service persists published items, a node owner may want to purge the node of all published items (thus removing all items from the persistent store, with the exception of the last published item, which MAY be cached). It is OPTIONAL for a service to implement this feature.
member.param: Jid of the pubsub service for this request

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.PubSubManager.PurgeNode(Matrix.Jid,System.String,System.EventHandler{Matrix.Xmpp.Client.IqEventArgs})
member.summary:
Purges all node item.
If a service persists published items, a node owner may want to purge the node of all published items (thus removing all items from the persistent store, with the exception of the last published item, which MAY be cached). It is OPTIONAL for a service to implement this feature.
Jid of the pubsub service for this request The node. The cb.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.Status
member.summary: The OPTIONAL status contains a natural-language description of availability status. It is normally used in conjunction with the show element to provide a detailed description of an availability state (e.g., "In a meeting").

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.Show
member.summary: The OPTIONAL show element contains non-human-readable XML character data that specifies the particular availability status of an entity or specific resource.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.Priority
member.summary: The priority level of the resource. The value MUST be an integer between -128 and +127. If no priority is provided, a server SHOULD consider the priority to be zero.
member.remarks: For information regarding the semantics of priority values in stanza routing within instant messaging and presence applications, refer to Server Rules for Handling XML StanzasServer Rules for Handling XML Stanzas.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.AnonymousLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we want to login anonymous. This works only when supported by the server. Otherwise an error is raised.
member.value: true if for anonymous login; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.RegisterNewAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a new Account should be registered on the server.
member.value: true if you want to try to register new account; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.StreamManagement

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.XmppClient.StreamResumption
member.summary: When set to true MatriX automatically enables stream resumption as defined in XEP-0198: Stream Management.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Jid
member.summary: Is used to specify a simple Jabber ID associated with this address. If the Jid is specified, the Uri proprty MUST NOT be set.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Description
member.summary: The Description is used to specify human-readable information for this address. This data may be used by clients to provide richer address-book integration.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Node
member.summary: This property is used to specify a sub-addressable unit at a particular JID, corresponding to a Service Discovery node. A node property MAY be set if a 'Jid' is specified. If a 'Uri' is specified, the 'Node' MUST NOT be specified.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Uri
member.summary: Is used to specify an external system address, such as a sip:, sips:, or im: URI. If the Uri is set, the Jid and Node peroperties MUST NOT be specified.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Delivered
member.summary: When a multicast service delivers the stanza to a non-bcc address, it MUST set Delivered = true. A multicast service MUST NOT deliver to an address that was marked with Delivered = true when the service received the stanza. A multicast service SHOULD attempt to deliver to all addresses that are not marked with Delivered = true.

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.#ctor
member.summary: XEP-0080 Geographical Location (GeoLoc) Defines a format for capturing data about an entity's geographical location (geoloc). The format defined herein is intended to provide a semi-structured format for describing a geographical location that may change fairly frequently, where the geoloc information is provided as Global Positioning System (GPS) coordinates.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Description
member.summary: A natural-language name for or description of the location.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.PostalCode
member.summary: A code used for postal delivery (eg. 74080).

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Region
member.summary: An administrative region of the nation, such as a state or province.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Room
member.summary: A particular room in a building.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Street
member.summary: A thoroughfare within the locality, or a crossing of two thoroughfares.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Text
member.summary: A catch-all element that captures any other information about the location.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Datum
member.summary: The GPS datum.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Building
member.summary: A specific building on a street or in an area.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Country
member.summary: The nation where the user is located.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.CountryCode
member.summary: The ISO 3166 two-letter country code (eg. "US").

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Area
member.summary: A named area such as a campus or neighborhood.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Locality
member.summary: A locality within the administrative region, such as a town or city.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Floor
member.summary: A particular floor in a building.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Altitude
member.summary: Altitude in meters above or below sea level

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Bearing
member.summary: GPS bearing (direction in which the entity is heading to reach its next waypoint), measured in decimal degrees relative to true north.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Accuracy
member.summary: Horizontal GPS error in meters. This property obsoletes the Error property.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Speed
member.summary: The speed at which the entity is moving, in meters per second.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Latitude
member.summary: Latitude in decimal degrees North.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Longitude
member.summary: Longitude in decimal degrees East.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Error
member.summary: Horizontal GPS error in arc minutes. This property is deprecated in favor of Accuracy.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Timestamp
member.summary: UTC timestamp specifying the moment when the reading was taken.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.GeoLoc.GeoLoc.Uri
member.summary: A URI or URL pointing to information about the location.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.UnknownCondition
member.summary: unknown condition.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.AlternativeSession
member.summary: The party prefers to use an existing session with the peer rather than initiate a new session.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Busy
member.summary: The party is busy and cannot accept a session.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Cancel
member.summary: The initiator wishes to formally cancel the session initiation request.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.ConnectivityError
member.summary: The action is related to connectivity problems.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Decline
member.summary: The party wishes to formally decline the session.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Expired
member.summary: The session length has exceeded a pre-defined time limit (e.g., a meeting hosted at a conference service).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.FailedApplication
member.summary: The party has been unable to initialize processing related to the application type.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.FailedTransport
member.summary: The party has been unable to establish connectivity for the transport method.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.GeneralError
member.summary: The action is related to a non-specific application error.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Gone
member.summary: The entity is going offline or is no longer available.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.IncompatibleParameters
member.summary: The party supports the offered application type but does not support the offered or negotiated parameters.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.MediaError
member.summary: The action is related to media processing problems.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.SecurityError
member.summary: The action is related to a violation of local security policies.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Success
member.summary: The action is generated during the normal course of state management and does not reflect any error.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.Timeout
member.summary: A request has not been answered so the sender is timing out the request.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.UnsupportedApplications
member.summary: The party supports none of the offered application types.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Condition.UnsupportedTransports
member.summary: The party supports none of the offered transport methods.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Content.Creator
member.summary: Which party originally generated the content type (used to prevent race conditions regarding modifications);. The defined values are "Initiator" and "Responder" (where the default is "Initiator"). The value of the 'creator' for a given content type MUST always match the party that originally generated the content type, even for Jingle actions that are sent by the other party in relation to that content type (e.g., subsequent content-modify or transport-info messages). The combination of the 'creator' attribute and the 'name' attribute is unique among both parties to a Jingle session.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Content.Name
member.summary: A unique name or identifier for the content type according to the creator, which MAY have meaning to a human user in order to differentiate this content type from other content types (e.g., two content types containing video media could differentiate between "room-pan" and "slides"). If there are two content types with the same value for the 'name' attribute, they shall understood as alternative definitions for the same purpose (e.g., a legacy method and a standards-based method for establishing a voice call), typically to smooth the transition from an older technology to Jingle.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Content.Senders
member.summary: Which parties in the session will be generating content; the allowable values are "initiator", "none", "responder", and "both" (where the default is "both").

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Jingle.Content.Disposition
member.summary: ow the content definition is to be interpreted by the recipient. The meaning of this Property matches the "Content-Disposition" header as defined in RFC 2183 and applied to SIP by RFC 3261.

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event
member.summary: XEP-0022: Message Events

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.IsOffline
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been stored offline by the intended recipient's server. This event is triggered only if the intended recipient's server supports offline storage, has that support enabled, and the recipient is offline when the server receives the message for delivery.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.IsDelivered
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been delivered to the recipient. This signifies that the message has reached the recipient's Jabber client, but does not necessarily mean that the message has been displayed. This event is to be raised by the Jabber client.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.IsDisplayed
member.summary: Once the message has been received by the recipient's Jabber client, it may be displayed to the user. This event indicates that the message has been displayed, and is to be raised by the Jabber client. Even if a message is displayed multiple times, this event should be raised only once.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.IsComposing
member.summary: In threaded chat conversations, this indicates that the recipient is composing a reply to a message. The event is to be raised by the recipient's Jabber client. A Jabber client is allowed to raise this event multiple times in response to the same request, providing the original event is cancelled first.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.Type
member.summary: The type of the event.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.Event.Id
member.summary: 'id' attribute of the original message to which this event notification pertains. (If no 'id' attribute was included in the original message, then the id tag must still be included with no

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType
member.summary: XEP-0022: Message Event types

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType.None
member.summary: No event type specified.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType.Offline
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been stored offline by the intended recipient's server. This event is triggered only if the intended recipient's server supports offline storage, has that support enabled, and the recipient is offline when the server receives the message for delivery.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType.Delivered
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been delivered to the recipient. This signifies that the message has reached the recipient's Jabber client, but does not necessarily mean that the message has been displayed. This event is to be raised by the Jabber client.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType.Displayed
member.summary: Once the message has been received by the recipient's Jabber client, it may be displayed to the user. This event indicates that the message has been displayed, and is to be raised by the Jabber client. Even if a message is displayed multiple times, this event should be raised only once.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.MessageEvents.EventType.Composing
member.summary: In threaded chat conversations, this indicates that the recipient is composing a reply to a message. The event is to be raised by the recipient's Jabber client. A Jabber client is allowed to raise this event multiple times in response to the same request, providing the original event is cancelled first.

member.summary: Gets or sets the optional mood text.

member.summary: Gets or sets the user mood.

member.summary: Creates the Pubsub XmppXElement for this Mood.

member.summary: Removed all User Mood tags

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.None
member.summary: No mood set

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Afraid
member.summary: Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear; apprehensive.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Amazed
member.summary: Astonished; confounded with fear, surprise or wonder.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Amorous
member.summary: Inclined to love; having a propensity to love, or to sexual enjoyment; loving, fond, affectionate, passionate, lustful, sexual, etc.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Angry
member.summary: Displaying or feeling anger, i.e., a strong feeling of displeasure, hostility or antagonism towards someone or something, usually combined with an urge to harm.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Annoyed
member.summary: To be disturbed or irritated, especially by continued or repeated acts.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Anxious
member.summary: Full of anxiety or disquietude; greatly concerned or solicitous, esp. respecting something future or unknown; being in painful suspense.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Aroused
member.summary: To be stimulated in one's feelings, especially to be sexually stimulated.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Ashamed
member.summary: Feeling shame or guilt.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Bored
member.summary: Suffering from boredom; uninterested, without attention.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Brave
member.summary: Strong in the face of fear; courageous.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Calm
member.summary: Peaceful, quiet.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Cautious
member.summary: Taking care or caution; tentative.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Cold
member.summary: Feeling the sensation of coldness, especially to the point of discomfort.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Confident
member.summary: Feeling very sure of or positive about something, especially about one's own capabilities.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Confused
member.summary: Chaotic, jumbled or muddled.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Contemplative
member.summary: Feeling introspective or thoughtful.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Contented
member.summary: Pleased at the satisfaction of a want or desire; satisfied.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Cranky
member.summary: Grouchy, irritable; easily upset.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Crazy
member.summary: Feeling out of control; feeling overly excited or enthusiastic.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Creative
member.summary: Feeling original, expressive, or imaginative.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Curious
member.summary: Inquisitive; tending to ask questions, investigate, or explore.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Dejected
member.summary: Feeling sad and dispirited.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Depressed
member.summary: Severely despondent and unhappy.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Disappointed
member.summary: Defeated of expectation or hope; let down.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Disgusted
member.summary: Filled with disgust; irritated and out of patience.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Dismayed
member.summary: Feeling a sudden or complete loss of courage in the face of trouble or danger.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Distracted
member.summary: Having one's attention diverted; preoccupied.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Embarrassed
member.summary: Having a feeling of shameful discomfort.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Envious
member.summary: Feeling pain by the excellence or good fortune of another.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Excited
member.summary: Having great enthusiasm.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Flirtatious
member.summary: In the mood for flirting.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Frustrated
member.summary: Suffering from frustration; dissatisfied, agitated, or discontented because one is unable to perform an action or fulfill a desire.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Grateful
member.summary: Feeling appreciation or thanks.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Grieving
member.summary: Feeling very sad about something, especially something lost; mournful; sorrowful.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Grumpy
member.summary: Unhappy and irritable.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Guilty
member.summary: Feeling responsible for wrongdoing; feeling blameworthy.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Happy
member.summary: Experiencing the effect of favourable fortune; having the feeling arising from the consciousness of well-being or of enjoyment; enjoying good of any kind, as peace, tranquillity, comfort; contented; joyous.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Hopeful
member.summary: Having a positive feeling, belief, or expectation that something wished for can or will happen.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Hot
member.summary: Feeling the sensation of heat, especially to the point of discomfort.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Humbled
member.summary: Having or showing a modest or low estimate of one's own importance; feeling lowered in dignity or importance.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Humiliated
member.summary: Feeling deprived of dignity or self-respect.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Hungry
member.summary: Having a physical need for food.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Hurt
member.summary: Wounded, injured, or pained, whether physically or emotionally.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Impressed
member.summary: Favourably affected by something or someone.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.InAwe
member.summary: Feeling amazement at something or someone; or feeling a combination of fear and reverence.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.InLove
member.summary: Feeling strong affection, care, liking, or attraction..

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Indignant
member.summary: The indignant

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Interested
member.summary: Showing great attention to something or someone; having or showing interest.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Intoxicated
member.summary: Under the influence of alcohol; drunk.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Invincible
member.summary: Feeling as if one cannot be defeated, overcome or denied.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Jealous
member.summary: Fearful of being replaced in position or affection.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Lonely
member.summary: Feeling isolated, empty, or abandoned.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Lost
member.summary: Unable to find one's way, either physically or emotionally.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Lucky
member.summary: Feeling as if one will be favored by luck.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Mean
member.summary: Causing or intending to cause intentional harm; bearing ill will towards another; cruel; malicious.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Moody
member.summary: Given to sudden or frequent changes of mind or feeling; temperamental.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Nervous
member.summary: Easily agitated or alarmed; apprehensive or anxious.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Neutral
member.summary: Not having a strong mood or emotional state.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Offended
member.summary: Feeling emotionally hurt, displeased, or insulted.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Outraged
member.summary: Feeling resentful anger caused by an extremely violent or vicious attack, or by an offensive, immoral, or indecent act.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Playful
member.summary: Interested in play; fun, recreational, unserious, lighthearted; joking, silly.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Proud
member.summary: Feeling a sense of one's own worth or accomplishment.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Relaxed
member.summary: Having an easy-going mood; not stressed; calm.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Relieved
member.summary: Feeling uplifted because of the removal of stress or discomfort.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Remorseful
member.summary: Feeling regret or sadness for doing something wrong.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Restless
member.summary: Without rest; unable to be still or quiet; uneasy; continually moving.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Sad
member.summary: Feeling sorrow; sorrowful, mournful.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Sarcastic
member.summary: Mocking and ironical.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Satisfied
member.summary: Pleased at the fulfillment of a need or desire.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Serious
member.summary: Without humor or expression of happiness; grave in manner or disposition; earnest; thoughtful; solemn.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Shocked
member.summary: Surprised, startled, confused, or taken aback.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Shy
member.summary: Feeling easily frightened or scared; timid; reserved or coy.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Sick
member.summary: Feeling in poor health; ill.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Sleepy
member.summary: Feeling the need for sleep.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Spontaneous
member.summary: Acting without planning; natural; impulsive.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Stressed
member.summary: Suffering emotional pressure.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Strong
member.summary: Capable of producing great physical force; or, emotionally forceful, able, determined, unyielding.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Surprised
member.summary: Experiencing a feeling caused by something unexpected.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Thankful
member.summary: Showing appreciation or gratitude.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Thirsty
member.summary: Feeling the need to drink.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Tired
member.summary: In need of rest or sleep.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Undefined
member.summary: [Feeling any emotion not defined here.]

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Weak
member.summary: Lacking in force or ability, either physical or emotional.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Mood.Moods.Worried

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Muc.Role
member.summary: There are four defined roles that an occupant may have

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Muc.Role.None
member.summary: the absence of a role

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Muc.Role.Moderator
member.summary: A moderator is the most powerful occupant within the context of the room, and can to some extent manage other occupants's roles in the room.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Muc.Role.Participant
member.summary: A participant has fewer privileges than a moderator, although he or she always has the right to speak.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Muc.Role.Visitor
member.summary: A visitor is a more restricted role within the context of a moderated room, since visitors are not allowed to send messages to all occupants.

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Privacy.Stanza
member.summary: enum for block or allow communications. This flags could be combined under the following conditions.

list.item: All must stand alone, its not allowed to combine thsi flag
Message, Iq, IncomingPresence and Outgoing Presence could be combined, but its not allowed to combine more than 3 of this flag. If you need all of them you have to use the All flag

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.PubSub.SubscriptionState.None
member.summary: The node MUST NOT send event notifications or payloads to the Entity.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.PubSub.SubscriptionState.Pending
member.summary: An entity has requested to subscribe to a node and the request has not yet been approved by a node owner. The node MUST NOT send event notifications or payloads to the entity while it is in this state.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.PubSub.SubscriptionState.Unconfigured
member.summary: An entity has subscribed but its subscription options have not yet been configured. The node MAY send event notifications or payloads to the entity while it is in this state. The service MAY timeout unconfigured subscriptions.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.PubSub.SubscriptionState.Subscribed
member.summary: An entity is subscribed to a node. The node MUST send all event notifications (and, if configured, payloads) to the entity while it is in this state (subject to subscriber configuration and content filtering).

member.summary: A string that identifies a particular version of the roster information. The value MUST be generated only by the server and MUST be treated by the client as opaque. member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.Failure
member.summary: Sasl failure object.

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.Failure.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.Failure.#ctor(Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.Failure.Condition
member.summary: The failure condition

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.Failure.Text
member.summary: An optional text description for the authentication failure.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.Aborted
member.summary: The receiving entity acknowledges an abort element sent by the initiating entity; sent in reply to the abort element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.AccountDisabled
member.summary: The account of the initiating entity has been temporarily disabled; sent in reply to an auth element (with or without initial response data) or a response element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.CredentialsExpired
member.summary: The authentication failed because the initiating entity provided credentials that have expired; sent in reply to a response element or an auth element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.EncryptionRequired
member.summary: The mechanism requested by the initiating entity cannot be used unless the confidentiality and integrity of the underlying stream are protected (typically via TLS); sent in reply to an element (with or without initial response data).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.IncorrectEncoding
member.summary: The data provided by the initiating entity could not be processed because the [BASE64] (Josefsson, S., The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, July 2003.) encoding is incorrect (e.g., because the encoding does not adhere to the definition in Section 3 of [BASE64] (Josefsson, S., The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, July 2003.)); sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.InvalidAuthzId
member.summary: The authzid provided by the initiating entity is invalid, either because it is incorrectly formatted or because the initiating entity does not have permissions to authorize that ID; sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.InvalidMechanism
member.summary: The initiating entity did not provide a mechanism or requested a mechanism that is not supported by the receiving entity; sent in reply to an element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.MalformedRequest
member.summary: The request is malformed (e.g., the element includes initial response data but the mechanism does not allow that, or the data sent violates the syntax for the specified SASL mechanism); sent in reply to an abort, auth, challenge, or response element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.MechanismTooWeak
member.summary: The mechanism requested by the initiating entity is weaker than server policy permits for that initiating entity; sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.NotAuthorized
member.summary: The authentication failed because the initiating entity did not provide valid credentials (this includes but is not limited to the case of an unknown username); sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.TemporaryAuthFailure
member.summary: The authentication failed because of a temporary error condition within the receiving entity; sent in reply to an element or element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.UnknownCondition
member.summary: Unknown Condition

member.summary: is used to provide a sender-generated description of the file so the receiver can better understand what is being sent. It MUST NOT be sent in the result.

member.summary: Gets or sets the feature.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.Profile.FileTansfer.Range.Offset
member.summary: Specifies the position, in bytes, to start transferring the file data from. This defaults to zero (0) if not specified.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.Profile.FileTansfer.Range.Length
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes to retrieve starting at offset. This defaults to the length of the file from offset to the end.

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI
member.summary: XEP-0095: Stream Initiation

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.Id
member.summary: An opaque identifier. This value MUST be present on type='set', and MUST be a valid string. This SHOULD NOT be sent back on type='result', since the Id provides the only context needed. This value is generated by the Sender, and the same value MUST be used throughout a session when talking to the Receiver.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.MimeType
member.summary: Iidentifies the MIME-type for the data across the stream. This value MUST be a valid MIME-type as registered with the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) [3] (specifically, as listed at "http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types"). During negotiation, this value SHOULD be present, and is otherwise not required. If not included during negotiation, its value is assumed to be "binary/octect-stream".

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.Profile
member.summary: Defines the SI profile in use. This value MUST be present during negotiation, and is the namespace of the profile to use.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.File
member.summary: Gets or sets the file.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.Feature
member.summary: Gets or sets the feature.
